1. Internships: Participating in internships is one of the best ways to build your resume. It gives you hands-on experience in your desired field and also demonstrates your commitment to learning beyond the classroom.

2. Volunteer work: Students can participate in charitable events or volunteer as an opportunity to build their resume. Employers appreciate students who have donated their time to something they believe in.

3. Campus Involvement: Being involved in campus activities, clubs, and societies not only helps enrich student life but also shows potential employers that you are a well-rounded person outside of just academics.

4. Part-time jobs: Earning money while building job skills is a win-win situation. Students can get part-time job experience in their area of interest, thereby strengthening their resume.

5. Research Projects: Aspiring researchers can volunteer for research projects, work as research assistants or conduct research themselves. This experience will add value to their resume.

6. Certification Programs: Students can take relevant certification courses to add value to their resumes. Employers favor candidates with well-rounded education and skill sets.

7. Professional Networking: Students can attend job fairs, industry conferences, or other networking events. This helps them establish connections with people in the industry they hope to work in. This can ultimately lead to valuable internships or job opportunities.
